pullRequest.title: Refactor JvmMethodGen class
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose

Resolve #25252

Approach

Refactor generateLambdaMethod
Move main method generation to new class
Move lambda generation to a new class
Move init methods generation to a new class
Move stop method generation to a new class
Refactor method ordering in JvmMethodGen
Move MethodGen classes to its own package

Samples

N/A

Remarks

#26032 and #25357

Check List

 Read the Contributing Guide
 Updated Change Log
 Checked Tooling Support (#)
 Added necessary tests

 Unit Tests
 Spec Conformance Tests
 Integration Tests
 Ballerina By Example Tests


 Increased Test Coverage
 Added necessary documentation

 API documentation
 Module documentation in Module.md files
 Ballerina By Examples

nodes.bodyText: since declaration is missing in new classes.
"generateDepModInit" name is bit confusing. AFAIU this generating default methods like start, init
AFAIK this will gen modulestop method. "JvmStopMethodGen" sounds like method to stop the jvm. Shall we remove the JVM prefix( even from other class).  WDYT?
Name can be "InitMethodGen" to consistant with other method gen class names.

commit.message:
Move main method generation to new class

More refactoring by moving the main method generation code to a separate class.

Move lambda generation to a new class

More refactoring by moving the lambda byte code generation code to a separate class.

Move init methods generation to a new class

More refactoring by moving the init methods generation code to a separate class.

Move stop method generation to a new class

More refactoring by moving the stop method generation code to a separate class.

Refactor method ordering in JvmMethodGen

This is to acquire good vertical ordering of code.

Move MethodGen classes to its own package

The JvmMethodGen class is broken to multiple classes and moved to its own package.
Rename the classes so that they are no longer prefixed with 'Jvm'
